abstracts.cdata!:
The project not only achieved all its
            stated objectives satisfactorily, but also most of its
            actual achievements exceeded the targets; the institutional
            development impact has been rated as substantial while
            project sustainability has been rated likely. World Bank
            performance is judged as satisfactory: The Bank maintained a
            very good relationship with the Borrower and donors, which
            helped to expedite project implementation. Since the Bank
            carried out supervision every six months and the project
            provided comprehensive reporting, including progress on
            benchmarks during each mission, it was possible to identify
            all bottlenecks on time and resolve any outstanding issues
            jointly. Finally, the Bank's decision to grant two
            extensions of one year each came at a most crucial time
            without which the project would have been declared
            unsuccessful. Borrower performance also was satisfactory:
            The project benefited from continuity in the senior
            management of the Institute of Engineering (IOE); support
            for project design and objectives was uninterrupted.
            Similarly all of the five Deans of the IOE had been directly
            involved in the early planning stages of the project and all
            maintained strong commitment and support. Despite serious
            implementation delays during the first half of the project,
            some of which were beyond the control of the Borrower, the
            Borrower was not only able to improve implementation
            significantly but exceeded achievements in some areas.
